Politikus PDIP yang Laporkan Novel Disebut Tak Terkait Partai
07 Nov 2019, 00:30 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Politikus partai politik PDI Perjuangan Dewi Tanjung melaporkan penyidik KPK Novel Baswedan ke Polda Metro Jaya pada Rabu (6/11). (CNN Indonesia/Feybien Ramayanti)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Sekjen PDI Perjuangan (PDIP) Hasto Kristianto mengakui bahwa Dewi Tanjung yang melaporkan penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) Novel Baswedan ke Polda Metro Jaya merupakan salah satu calon anggota legislatif dari PDIP.Akan tetapi, Hasto mengklaim pelaporan Novel ke polisi merupakan sikap pribadi Dewi dan tak memiliki keterkaitan dengan PDIP."Dewi Tanjung dia menjadi salah satu caleg tapi apa yang dilakukan tidak terkait dengan partai... Terkait hal tersebut itu merupakan pribadi ya dari Dewi Tanjung," kata Hasto saat ditemui di Hotel Sultan, Jakarta, Rabu (8/11).Lebih lanjut, Hasto membantah PDIP menginstruksikan kadernya itu untuk melaporkan Novel ke polisi. Ia hanya menduga bahwa Dewi melaporkan Novel sesuai dengan suara yang ada di dalam hatinya."Apa yang dilakukan oleh anggota PDIP biasanya menyuarakan apa yang ada dalam suara hatinya dan itu juga berpijak kepada apa yg ditangkal dari suatu hal yang muncul dari rakyat itu sendiri," kata dia.Selain itu, Hasto sendiri belum mengetahui kalau ada orang yang melaporkan Novel ke polisi tersebut. Ia mengaku sedang fokus untuk mengerjakan konsolidasi internal PDIP untuk Pilkada serentak 2020."Saya enggak tau kalau ada yang melaporkan ya," kata dia.Sebelumnya, Dewi Tanjung melaporkan Novel ke Polda Metro Jaya pada Rabu (6/11). Dia melapor ke polisi karena mencurigai penyiraman air keras yang menimpa Novel pada 2017 lalu adalah rekayasa.Dewi mengaku curiga bahwa penyiraman tersebut hanya rekayasa Novel. Pasalnya banyak hal yang ia nilai janggal dalam kejadian itu.Laporan tersebut diterima Polda Metro Jaya dengan nomor polisi LP/7171/XI/2019/PMJ/Dit. Reskrimsus dengan dugaan pelanggaran Pasal 26 ayat (2) junto Pasal 45 A Ayat (2) UU RI nomor 19 tahun 2016 tentang ITE dan atau Pasal 14 A ayat 1 UU RI nomor 1 tahun 1946 tentang peraturan hukum pidana. (rzr/fea)

PDIP politicians who report novels are said to be unrelated to the party
Nov 7 2019, 00:30 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Political politician from the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle (PDI-P) Dewi Tanjung reported investigators from the KPK Novel Baswedan to the Jakarta Police on Wednesday (6/11). (CNN Indonesia / Feybien Ramayanti)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - PDI-P Secretary General (PDIP) Hasto Kristianto acknowledged that Dewi Tanjung who reported investigators at the Baswedan Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) to the Metro Jaya Regional Police was one of the candidates for legislative members from PDIP. However, Hasto claimed the novel's reporting to the the police are Dewi's personal attitude and have no connection with the PDIP. "Dewi Tanjung she is one of the candidates but what is done is not related to the party ... Related to this it is personal yes from Dewi Tanjung," Hasto said when met at the Sultan Hotel Jakarta, Wednesday (8/11). Furthermore, Hasto denied that the PDI-P had instructed the cadre to report the novel to the police. He only guessed that Dewi reported the Novel in accordance with the voice in her heart. "What is done by PDIP members usually voices what is in their conscience and that it also rests on what is denied from something that arises from the people themselves," he said. In addition, Hasto himself did not know if anyone reported the novel to the police. He claimed to be focusing on working on the internal consolidation of PDIP for the simultaneous local elections in 2020. "I don't know if anyone reported it," he said. Previously, Dewi Tanjung reported the novel to the Metro Jaya Regional Police on Wednesday (6/11). He reported to the police for suspecting that the hard watering that hit Novel in 2017 was fabricated. Dewi admitted he suspected that the watering was only novel engineering. The reason is many things that he judged odd in the incident. The report was received by the Jakarta Police with the police number LP / 7171 / XI / 2019 / PMJ / Dit. Reskrimsus with alleged violation of Article 26 paragraph (2) junto Article 45 A Paragraph (2) RI Law number 19 of 2016 concerning ITE and or Article 14 A paragraph 1 of RI Law number 1 of 1946 concerning criminal law regulations.
